definition: to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack

sentences.english: Has the patient ever had the same or similar symptoms(s) before?
sentences.chinese: 就诊者以前曾否患有同类或类似病征？

sentences.english: How long have these symptoms existed prior to the first consultation?
sentences.chinese: 该等病征在首次求诊前已存在多久？

sentences.english: But these results alone are never diagnostic of the disease.
sentences.chinese: 但是这些结果单独看来并非疾病的病征。

sentences.english: He found telltale signs of AIDS on her tongue and around her genitals.
sentences.chinese: 他在她的舌头上和生殖器周围找到爱滋病的病征。

sentences.english: How long, in your opinion, has the patient suffered from these symptoms?
sentences.chinese: 根据阁下的专业意见，就诊者已患有此病征多长时间？

sentences.english: Neurotics have none of the characteristics of perverts.
sentences.chinese: 精神官能症患者并没有变态狂的病征。

sentences.english: Hemoptysis is described in many disease processes.
sentences.chinese: 很多疾病的病征会表现出咳血。

sentences.english: It is the rash you get when you have been stung by nettles .
sentences.chinese: 这是出疹的病征，你当你已丁由荨麻。

sentences.english: As you know Joyce had a hard time with this sinthome.
sentences.chinese: 你们知道，乔埃斯跟这个病征奋斗很长一段时间。

sentences.english: The virus can hole up in the body for up to 10 years without triggering symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 爱滋病毒可以在体内潜伏十年而没有任何病征。

sentences.english: Conclusion It is necessary to introduce STD syndromic management into China.
sentences.chinese: 结论在中国推行性病病征处理是十分必要的。
